form.preferredDefinition: This protocol encompasses the self-reported prior, current, or ideal body image of the respondents and their children. The majority of studies using pictograms have used the Stunkard Figure Rating Scale, which contains nine silhouettes on an ordinal scale. An alternative, the Collins scale, has also been provided. Specific pictograms for African Americans and children are also included.

question.questionText: Male or female pictures presented/chosen for the age of 5. (body_image_gender_5)
Collins Child Female image (collins_child_female_images_1)
Collins Child Male image (collins_child_male_1)
Choose the picture that most closely resembles your (or your child's) body shape at the age of 5. (body_image_5)
Scale Used for Child Body Image. (body_image_5_scale)

Choose the picture that most closely resembles your body shape at the age of 20. (body_image_20)

Collins Scale image (body_image_collins_scale)
Stunkard Scale or Pulvers image (body_image_stunkard_scale)
Participant's Children CHILD 1 image (body_image_collins_child_1)
Participant's Children CHILD 2 image (body_image_collins_child_2)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol encompasses the self-reported prior, current, or ideal body image of the respondents and their children. The majority of studies using pictograms have used the Stunkard Figure Rating Scale, which contains nine silhouettes on an ordinal scale. An alternative, the Collins scale, has also been provided. Specific pictograms for African Americans and children are also included.

form.longName: PhenX PX020601 - Hand Dominance 42 Months And Older
form.preferredDefinition: The protocol consists of questions to determine which hand the participant uses for a series of activities. Adults will assist children beginning at 42 months of age.

question.questionText: Child hand used in drawing (child_hand_drawing)
Child hand used in throwing a ball (child_hand_throwing)
Child hand used in coloring (child_hand_coloring)
Child hand used in holding a toothbrush (child_hand_holding_toothbrush)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The protocol consists of questions to determine which hand the participant uses for a series of activities. Adults will assist children beginning at 42 months of age.

form.longName: PhenX PX020602 - Hand Dominance 12 Years And Older
form.preferredDefinition: The protocol consists of questions to determine which hand the participant uses for a series of activities.

question.questionText: Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in writing. (hand_write)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in drawing. (hand_draw)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in throwing. (hand_throw)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in holding a racquet. (hand_hold_racquet)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in cleaning teeth. (hand_clean_teeth)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in hammering. (hand_hammer)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in striking a match. (hand_strike_match)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in using an eraser. (hand_use_eraser)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in dealing cards. (hand_deal_card)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in threading a needle. (hand_thread_needle)
Please indicate your preferences in the use of hands in cutting food with a knife. (hand_cut_food)
How many "Right hand" in Questions 111? (hand_total_right)
How many "Left hand" in Questions 111? (hand_total_left)
How many "Both hands" in Questions 111? (hand_total_both)
SCORE = 100 x (TOTAL_RIGHT TOTAL_LEFT) / (TOTAL_RIGHT + TOTAL_LEFT + TOTAL_BOTH) (handedness_score)
Handedness is classified by the score. (handedness)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The protocol consists of questions to determine which hand the participant uses for a series of activities.

form.preferredDefinition: Knee height is measured as the distance from the surface over the femoral condyles to the heel, with the knee flexed to approximately 90 degrees. This measure is used for individuals who are 60 years of age or older, who are unable to stand, or who have spinal deformities. It may be necessary to take replicate measurements.

headerInstruction.text: Knee height was measured on adults 60 years of age and older during National Health and Nutrition Examination Study III, 198894. Measurements are taken in the seated position with both legs dangling. The examiner places the fixed blade of the ..TRUNCATED

protocol.preferredDefinition: Knee height is measured as the distance from the surface over the femoral condyles to the heel, with the knee flexed to approximately 90 degrees. This measure is used for individuals who are 60 years of age or older, who are unable to stand, or who have spinal deformities. It may be necessary to take replicate measurements.

form.preferredDefinition: The questions in the protocol ask the study subject his or her height.NOTE: Self-reported height values are considered to be less accurate. Self-reported height is subject to error and is used when measured height cannot be obtained.

question.questionText: How tall {are you/is [participant]} without shoes? ENTER HEIGHT IN FEET AND INCHES OR METERS AND CENTIMETERS (self_reported_height_coded)
Feet (self_reported_height_feet)
Inches (self_reported_height_inches)
Meters (self_reported_height_meters)
Centimeters (self_reported_height_centimeters)
Proxy Name (self_reported_height_proxy_name)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The questions in the protocol ask the study subject his or her height.NOTE: Self-reported height values are considered to be less accurate. Self-reported height is subject to error and is used when measured height cannot be obtained.
